context/2: They got out and paid off.
context/6: So I drove them around until, all of a sudden, one of them says:
context/7: They wanted to go to a certain place in Beverly Hills, only they didn't know the address.
context/8: A couple of ladies I picked up on Sunset.

context: Had he ever consulted you at your office?
response: Not that I recall.
context/1: Had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you were called in?
context/2: I live just around the corner.
context/4: Are you the only doctor in the neighbourhood?
context/5: He said one of his guests was ill.
context/6: The owner of the Vista Motel.
context/9: Dr. Renault, when was the first time you were called in to treat Mr. Davenport?

context: By the way,
response: I find it remarkable how you gentleman of the press arrived at the spot so quickly.
context/1: Please drink up and pay up.
context/2: Time, gentleman.
context/4: Come on now, Sergeant, we're talking about progress and you can't report anything because you haven't made any.
context/5: Then the criminal would know what we're doing, too, wouldn't he?
context/6: Now, look here, you can't expect us to tell you every move we make, you know.
context/8: And you must confess, you haven't given me very much to turn in so far.
context/9: I just have to turn in a story each day.
